content: Last year there was a feedback that we should include Blockchain in the industries you work in, because that's where lots of Rustaceans nowadays work in. We should probably add it there this year as well.
Agreed, seems good (cc @Jasun Carr :point_up:)
Done

It seems that the survey this year has 50% more questions than last year... Is the 10~15 min estimated time still accurate? If the time scales linearly with number of questions, it should probably take 15~20 min this year. Have we done some timing and see how long it takes for people to complete it?
I think 15-20 min is a better estimate to write, personally. (but this also may be a sign that we need to find ways to put bounds on survey size)
In Question 30. Do you want to put CLion aside with IntelliJ or make it a separate option?

Accidentally posted in reply on wrong thread, so copied here as well:

I'll do a comparison between last/this year (think the number of questions may not have increased that much, but we added some questions with a LOT of choices)

So, you're right - the overall # of questions did increase from 85 -> 130 (a 52.9% increase). However, because of branching and filtering within the survey, the Maximum # of questions anyone will have to answer only 71 (last year it was 67). So, the survey itself has gotten larger - but the experience should be equivalent.
(And, if anyone is interested, the minimum # of questions someone would have to answer also increased slightly from 31 to 39).
That's pretty interesting
Thanks @Jasun Carr
I think putting CLion in the IntelliJ option makes sense, something like "IntelliJ (incl. CLion etc.)" would probably work.

There is a feedback about the question "If you use a nightly version, do you automatically update or pin a version for use?" that this should probably be using checkbox, because people may pin a version for some products (e.g. for production), and let it automatically update for others. Not sure whether there is anything better we can do with this question.
hello everyone, I'm helping with the Italian translation of the survey. I've completed a first version, I'll have another person review it soon.

I know I'm late to the party but I have noted down some minor feedbacks on the survey itself. It's perfectly ok simply ignore the following small bullet list :-)

  • Demographics section: we can maybe short down the list of underrepresented minorites using LGBTQIA+ for everything related to gender, to my knowledge it's the accepted all-comprehensive shorthand.
  • Rust Conferences section: I find a bit confusing that long list of countries and one additional free input question. I would remove the question with the checkboxes and simply leave the free input question "Where would you travel to attend a Rust conf".
  • In the closing section of the survey there is a mention to the 2018 survey ("hey thanks you'll find the 2018 results here ...").. That survey is not yet linked on the github repo wiki.
    Other than these points, the survey is simply amazing, congrats to those that wrote and maintain it!

So, one actionable item:

  • Publish the results of the 2018 survey here
    https://github.com/rust-community/team/wiki/State-of-the-Rust-Language-Community-Survey-FAQ#where-can-i-see-the-previous-survey-reports
    because it is referenced in the final survey greetings
